p: The intracellular ROS level as indicative of antioxidant capacity of P. atlantica subsp. mutica was measured in cells treated with 24 mM H 2O 2 alone or with different extracts in B16F10 melanoma cells. The results indicated that all extracts concentrations of P. atlantica subsp. mutica except for the 0.2 Î¼g/mL of CH 2Cl 2 extract could significantly suppress the oxidative stress induced by H 2O 2( P < 0.05) ( Fig. 5).
